column4: when using mplayer to play videos etc, I'd like to be able to disable my power saving settings (eg turn monitor off after 45 mins), how can I do that?
System > Preferences > Screensaver
not my screensaver, my power saving settings?
one sec
System > Preferences > Power Management
write a shell script?
I know Apple has made different energy saver settings for this kind of stuff, but Ubuntu isn't an Apple product
I guess it I see it's silly that it isn't in some gui setting already.. You'd think when you play a video that you don't want the monitor to go into standby mode
I don't know, I don't have that problem
partly because I don't watch movies on my PC, and partly because I just kill my screensaver before I watch one
the screensaver isn't the problem, it's power saving :)
what kind of moniter?
